abstracts.cdata!:
The Brazil Environmental Sustainability
            Agenda Technical Assistance Project supports the Government
            on advancing the pace of reforms supporting the Programmatic
            Reform Loan for Environmental Sustainability as defined in
            the Policy Letter presented by the government on July
            7,2004. There are five project components: 1) strengthening
            of the environmental management system, including defining
            environmental indicators and bolstering the Ministry of
            Environment's management capacity; 2) improving
            biodiversity conservation and the sustainable use of natural
            resources (the "Green Agenda"); 3) improving
            management of environmental risks due to hazardous chemicals
            (the "Brown Agenda"); 4) improving water resources
            management (the "Blue Agenda"); and 5)
            mainstreaming environmental sustainability in selected
            government sectors (e.g., fiscal sector, hydropower sector,
            tourism, etc.).
